meanings.definition: A thin membrane or layer of tissue.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the brane to check for any tears or damage.
meanings.sent2: The brane surrounding the brain helps protect it from harm.
meanings.sent3: The brane stretched like a delicate sheet of paper in the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were shielded by a brane, keeping them private and secure.
meanings.sent5: The brane was so thin, you could almost see through it.

meanings.definition: A flexible material used for packaging or covering.
meanings.sent1: She wrapped the fragile item in a brane before placing it in the box.
meanings.sent2: The store used brane to wrap the products for shipping.
meanings.sent3: The brane crinkled like a plastic bag as she folded it around the gift.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a protective brane, shielding her from the harsh truth.
meanings.sent5: The brane was so smooth and shiny, it reflected the light beautifully.

meanings.definition: To separate or divide into sections or compartments.
meanings.sent1: She tried to brane her study time into smaller, more manageable chunks.
meanings.sent2: He needed to brane the tasks to prioritize his workload effectively.
meanings.sent3: The teacher decided to brane the students into groups for the group project.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to naturally brane different thoughts into categories.
meanings.sent5: The chef would brane the ingredients before starting to cook the dish.
